item.description:
It's time for another FREE classical music concert for the fall season!

Tonight, Maestro Hugh Wolff once again conducts the NEC Philharmonia orchestra, performing works from Haydn, Barber and Bart贸k. The Haydn piece is lovely, and the Bart贸k piece is a bit more challenging. Tonight's soloist will be violinist Hannah Choi, chosen through an NEC concerto competition to be the soloist for this program. For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/n...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the back full row of the center floor section, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find, but if the balcony is open, I try to grab a section on the left side as it affords a really good view of the orchestra.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • Haydn Symphony No. 90 in C Major listen to the 4th movement here
  • Barber Violin Concerto listen to the 3rd movement here
  • Bart贸k The Miraculous Mandarin Suite listen to the 1st part here
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series: Wolff conducts Haydn, Barber & Bart贸k
